intro: This is the introduction to the whole map, before users have selected a decade.
In the final decade of the 17th century, Deerfield was a struggling frontier town. The families who lived here were too poor to purchase enslaved people, with the exception of Reverend John Williams.

popItems.title: Robert Tigo

intro: This decade was witness to the 1704 French and Indian raid on Deerfield which set the town back in many ways. Several families moved away but others began to be more well off and able to purchase enslaved people.
